column4: Hello, I have installled Ubuntu 11.04 Gnome. I am trying to Setup Bluetooth. But I have been unable to. I have tried both : Service Bluetooth Restart and killall bluetoothd, bluetoothd... I tried and searched internet for other methods but have not been able to find one. Can anybody please suggest some other workaround.
if you run:  bluetooth-applet    is it ok?
if you run:  dmesg | grep -i blu     does it show a bluetooth adapter being picked up?
I have tried it once... I showed bluetooth adapter. Next time when it was not working... I did not see that...using the same command
Is there a way to turn on the bluetooth directly from the BIOS. As the Bug Report page sayed that the bluetooth works out of the box if it is already on.....
depends on the BIOS, go have a look :)
is there a switch on the keyboard or otherwise to turn bluetooth off and on?
if you run:   lsmod | grep btusb     do you get any output?
Yes there is. For Wireless and Bluetooth. I have tried that as well. It does not work...
I am currently using Windows. I use bluetooth to use internet. So I would have to bboot into ubuntu and run and see. I have not run that commmand
So I would note downn the Commmand. I would shut down and boot into Ubuntu run and come back here and tell you the output.... Can you suggest me what to do in both the cases of failure and success?
i suggest you use another connection to get updated, may help
Ok.. So you are suggesting me to use another source for internet and come online here again...Right?
yes an ethernet connection will probably just work, then you can get updated
I did update ubuntu from the Update Manager when I had the ethernet. Is there another source for Bluetooth module?
its part of the kernel stuffs, you may find you just need the bluetooth module loading
Ok... I would do that... Thanks for the time you gace... Thank you..
